CONFIDENTIALITY CLAUSE:

Exhibit 10.2 contains certain portions that have been deliberately omitted from this document, in accordance with our application for protective order under Rule 24b-2 of the General Rules and Regulations governing the Securities Exchange Act. The details concealed, represented as "[***]" within this exhibit, have been submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission alongside our request for confidentiality treatment. It is understood that any party with access to this document shall respect the confidentiality of these omitted portions and not disclose or disseminate them without express written consent from the originator.

original: WHEREAS, PlanetCAD, SPATIAL COMPONENTS, LLC and DASSAULT SYSTEMS CORP. entered into a certain Purchase Agreement, dated July 4, 2000 ("Purchase Agreement"), pursuant to which DASSAULT SYSTEMES CORP. acquired the Component Business (as defined in the Purchase Agreement) from PlanetCAD and SPATIAL COMPONENTS, LLC, including certain software; and WHEREAS, PlanetCAD has created, operates and maintains its own Web sites, including, without limitation 3Dshare.com and PlanetCAD.com, through which PlanetCAD provides Internet-based services to its customers, and has competence and expertise in the supply of Internet-based services to customers.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, on July 4, 2000, a Purchase Agreement ("Purchase Agreement") was executed among PlanetCAD, SPATIAL COMPONENTS, LLC, and DASSAULT SYSTEMS CORP., whereby DASSAULT SYSTEMES CORP. acquired the Component Business (as defined in the Purchase Agreement), which included certain software, from PlanetCAD and SPATIAL COMPONENTS, LLC; and WHEREAS, it is recognized that PlanetCAD possesses its own Web sites, namely 3Dshare.com and PlanetCAD.com, whereby they offer Internet-based services to their customers, and it is acknowledged that PlanetCAD has the capability and know-how in providing such Internet-based services.

In this revised clause, the emphasis has been shifted from PlanetCAD actively creating, operating, and maintaining its Web sites to acknowledging that they possess these Web sites and have the capability to offer Internet-based services. This change subtly weakens the obligation implied in the original clause without significantly altering the overall meaning.

original: SECTION 1 DEFINITIONS All capitalized terms not otherwise defined herein shall have the same meanings set forth in the Asset Purchase Agreement.

All capitalized terms used but not explicitly defined within this agreement shall be construed according to their definitions as outlined in the Asset Sale Agreement.

original: 3.3 Limited Hosting License. The parties expressly agree that the Dassault Systemes Customer Databases and their content as well as Dassault Systemes Customers input data to be processed and output data supplied, are confidential information of Dassault Systemes , and will be treated as such, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the CNDA.
ollama_generated:

The receiving party shall maintain the confidentiality of this data at all times, in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Non-Disclosure Agreement (CNDA), but with the understanding that its disclosure may be required by law or court order.

In this revised clause, the obligation to maintain confidentiality has been shifted from Dassault Systemes to a third party receiving the data. Additionally, an exception for the disclosure of data in compliance with legal obligations has been added to make the clause more realistic and practical.

original: (a) The performance of this Agreement does not infringe or conflict with any Intellectual Property right of any third party, and (ii) no confidential, proprietary or trade secret information of either party or their personnel that will be used in performing this Agreement has been misappropriated from any third party; and (b) All services, work, obligations or assignments performed by either party under this Agreement will be of professional quality, conforming to generally accepted practices within the industry, and the Infrastructure including Third Party Software  shall function and perform to the specifications and requirements thereof.
ollama_generated: (a) While executing this Agreement, neither party will engage in activities that violate or potentially infringe upon any Intellectual Property rights of a third party. However, we acknowledge that it is the responsibility of each party to ensure their own compliance with intellectual property laws and regulations. Additionally, neither party shall disclose or use confidential, proprietary, or trade secret information of the other party or their respective personnel without explicit written authorization, unless such information has already been made publicly available or is commonly known within the industry. (b) Each party will strive to deliver services, work, obligations, or assignments under this Agreement with a high degree of skill and care, commensurate with customary practices in the relevant industry. Notwithstanding, it is recognized that no system, including Third Party Software, is without potential faults or errors, and neither party will be held liable for any temporary disruptions or minor performance issues that may occur, as long as they do not materially affect the overall functionality of the Infrastructure.

original: 9.3 Intellectual Property Infringement.Each Party agrees to hold the other Party, its subsidiaries and distributors and assignees harmless from and against any claim of any nature, including, but not limited to, administrative, civil or criminal procedures, which is or may be made or raised against this Party, its subsidiaries and distributors and assignees by any third party that the use or distribution of the Software  or any other intellectual property that is the subject of this Agreement and owned or licensed by this Party, infringes or violates any third party's patent, copyright, trade secret or other intellectual property right in any country. Indemnification hereunder shall cover all damages, regardless of their nature, settlements, expenses and costs, including costs of investigation, court costs and attorneys' fees. modified:
9.3 Intellectual Property Liability Limitations: Each Party acknowledges its sole responsibility for ensuring the legality of its use and distribution of the Software, or any other intellectual property under this Agreement that is owned or licensed by it. Neither Party, nor its subsidiaries, distributors, or assignees shall be liable to any third party for any claim, administrative, civil, or criminal, arising from an alleged infringement or violation of the third party's patent, copyright, trade secret, or other intellectual property right, concerning the Software or said intellectual property, in any country. Any potential liability under this indemnification clause shall be limited to direct damages and shall not cover indirect, special, consequential, incidental, or punitive damages, settlements, expenses, or costs, including investigation, court, and attorney fees. The right to claim indemnification under this agreement is contingent upon:

1. Notification being given promptly by the claiming Party about the specific allegation of infringement or violation;
2. The other Party being granted control over the litigation process, at its sole discretion, subject to the claiming Party's reasonable cooperation; and
3. The claiming Party not admitting any liability or settling any claim without the indemnifying Party's consent.

original: (a)  This Party giving prompt written notice to the other of any such claim or allegation; (b)  Cooperation by this Party with the other Party in its defense against the claim; and (c)  This Party obtaining the other's prior written approval of any settlement, if any, by this Party of such matters, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld.
ollama_generated: (a) It is incumbent upon this Party to provide prompt, written notice to the other regarding any claims or allegations that may arise; (b) This Party shall extend reasonable cooperation to the other in their pursuit of defense against such claims; and (c) Any settlements pertaining to these matters must be agreed upon by both Parties, with undue delay in granting prior written consent for such settlements being discouraged.

original: In the event a Derivative Work, created under this Agreement, becomes the subject of a claim of infringement, the owner of said Derivative Work shall indemnify the other Party pursuant to this Section 9.

original: 9.4 LIMITATIONS ON LIABILITY. EXCEPT FOR LIABILITY ARISING FROM SECTION 9.3   [Intellectual Property Infringement] , IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, LOSSES, OR EXPENSES INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOSS OF USE, LOSS OF PROFITS, OR LOSS OF GOODWILL, EVEN IF THAT PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH LOSS OR DAMAGE.
ollama_generated: 9.4 CAP ON RESPONSIBILITY. Except for liability incurred under Section 9.3 [Intellectual Property Infringement], neither Party shall be held responsible for direct damages that exceed the amount paid or payable by one Party to the other, under this Agreement, within the preceding twelve months. This cap on liability applies regardless of whether a Party has been informed of the possibility of such loss or damage. Furthermore, neither Party will have any obligation or responsibility for indirect, special, incidental, punitive, or consequential damages, losses, or expenses, including but not limited to, loss of use, loss of profits, or loss of goodwill.

original: 11.2 Freedom of Action. Except as otherwise provided, nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed to limit or impair any right of either party to enter into similar agreements with other parties, or to develop, acquire, license or market, directly or indirectly, other products or services, competitive with those offered by the other party.

This clause does not create an obligation for either party to prioritize their commitments under this Agreement over such independent activities.

original: 11.8 Severability. If any term or other provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced by any law or public policy, all other terms and provisions of this Agreement shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect so long as the economic or legal substance of the transactions contemplated hereby is not affected in any manner materially adverse to any party.

original: 11.17 Assignment; Subcontracting; Third Party Beneficiaries.
modified:
11.17 Delegation of Obligations; Outsourcing; Third-Party Rights.

In this Agreement, the Client acknowledges and agrees that it may not delegate or outsource its obligations under this Agreement to any third party without the express written consent of the Service Provider. The Service Provider shall have the right to perform any of its obligations under this Agreement through a subcontractor, provided that such subcontractor is suitably qualified and capable of performing the services required by this Agreement. This Agreement is not intended to confer any rights or benefits upon any third party, and no third party shall have any right to enforce any provision of this Agreement.

original: (c) Either Party may subcontract services necessary to perform the obligations set forth in this Agreement provided that any and all such subcontractors shall have entered into agreements with the subcontracting Party sufficient to enable that Party to comply with all terms and conditions of this Agreement.
